text: The Danish Girl is a 2015 biographical romantic drama movie directed by Tom Hooper. It is based on the 2000 novel of the same name by David Ebershoff. It is inspired by the lives of Danish painters Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener. == Casts == The movie stars Eddie Redmayne as Elbe, one of the first known recipients of sex reassignment surgery, Alicia Vikander as Wegener, and Sebastian Koch as Kurt Warnekros, with Ben Whishaw, Amber Heard, and Matthias Schoenaerts in supporting roles. == Release == The movie was released in a limited release on 27 November 2015 by Focus Features in the United States. The movie received some criticism for its wrong portrayal of historical events, but Redmayne and Vikander's performances received widespread acclaim. Vikander won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress and Redmayne was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Actor. ==References== Category:2015 romantic drama movies Category:2010s biographical movies Category:2015 LGBT movies Category:British romantic drama movies Category:British biographical movies Category:British LGBT movies Category:Danish LGBT movies Category:Danish romance movies Category:Danish drama movies Category:Danish biographical movies Category:Belgian LGBT movies Category:Belgian romance movies Category:Belgian drama movies Category:Belgian biographical movies Category:Japanese LGBT movies Category:Japanese romance movies Category:Japanese drama movies Category:Japanese biographical movies Category:German romance movies Category:German drama movies Category:German LGBT movies Category:German biographical movies Category:Movies based on books Category:Movies directed by Tom Hooper Category:Movies set in the 1920s Category:Movies set in Denmark Category:Movies set in Germany Category:Movies set in Paris
title: The Danish Girl (movie)
